name: Art BA
overview: The Art major is a designated capstone major. As part of the upper-division advanced studio requirements, all undergraduate students are required to complete a senior studio course that emphasizes analysis and criticism of individual creative work and ideas. Students develop and present a body of creative work in which they exhibit familiarity with and competence in a range of techniques and media, and a level of proficiency in utilizing particular media appropriate to advanced-level studio projects. Graduates are expected to demonstrate familiarity with global historical precedents for and issues in contemporary art, to understand terms and concepts relevant to contemporary art discourse, and to have the ability to effectively articulate analysis of works of art to participate in a studio critique.
college: School of the Arts and Architecture

sections.title: Preparation for the Major
sections.description: Complete the following nine required courses and one art history elective:

requirements.title: Art History Elective
requirements.description: Select one course from: Art History 20 through 31

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete a minimum of nine upper-division courses as follows:

requirements.title: Studio Areas
requirements.description: Select six courses from at least four of the following studio areas. At least one must be designated with an A.

requirements.title: Art History Elective
requirements.description: Select one course from the following course or range: ART M184 or Art History M110A through 185.

sections.title: Policies
sections.description: Each course applied toward major requirements must be taken for a letter grade, with the exception of Art 190, 193, and 195, which are offered only on a Passed/Not Passed grading basis. Of those, no more than 4 units total may be applied toward the upper-division art elective requirement.
